title: Coping With Loss | True Ghost Stories
description: What happens when one is forced to cope with a shocking loss, only to have the very person who passed, return from the grave? Here is a preview of the story. “A few years went by, and he passed away in a terrible motorcycle accident. A few days after he pasted, my wife and I thought about what we could do to try and cope with the loss. We decided to go to one of the fishing holes that he and I always fished at, in honor of him. When we pulled up, we started walking the trail that led into the woods and a couple miles down there was a small lake. As we reached the lake a giant coyote came walking out of the trees. He did not seem angry or want to mess with us. He just looked at us for a few minutes and went about his way down the shoreline. I remember my stepbrother loving coyotes, he even had a tattoo of one and right then I knew it was him giving me a sign. Fast forward to present day. That was a couple years ago now. Just the other day I was listening to your show, it was around 8 AM. I remember you and carol, and it was the episode a woman was talking about how a rainbow reminded her of someone she loved and as she is saying this, I am thinking about the time I seen the coyote. I had GPS on because I was trying reach a destination around an area I did not know very well. My GPS started rendering and saying," rerouting " " rererouting", finally it told me take a right in 100 feet. I slowed down in a panic and the safest way possible. Then it started rendering again. I was a little frustrated, so I pulled over in the nearest drive I seen. It was a large iron gate; I then exited out of GPS and opened the app back up. It corrected itself so I put my car in reverse and looked back up.” Watch more at: http://www.realghoststoriesonline.com/ If you have a real ghost story or supernatural event to report, please write into our show or call 1-855-853-4802!
